body_html:
From GIT blame, it seems that test was added 5 days ago. TensorFlow version
0.9.0 is several weeks old so you need to build from source.

You can select which variables are saved by specifying it in Saver
constructor

On Wed, Jun 29, 2016 at 4:42 AM, 郑泽宇 notifications@github.com wrote:

btw, if I use different name scopes for different runs, will the server
stores all the variables from different runs and uses lots of disk?

—
You are receiving this because you commented.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub

or mute the thread

body:
From GIT blame, it seems that test was added 5 days ago. TensorFlow version
0.9.0 is several weeks old so you need to build from source.

You can select which variables are saved by specifying it in Saver
constructor

On Wed, Jun 29, 2016 at 4:42 AM, 郑泽宇 notifications@github.com wrote:

> btw, if I use different name scopes for different runs, will the server
> stores all the variables from different runs and uses lots of disk?
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/3073#issuecomment-229233828,
> or mute the thread
